property.name: Traits
property.value: Gondor. Ranger.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After you engage an enemy, add 1 resource to Mablung's resource pool. (Limit once per phase.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Action: Take control of the first player token and draw 1 card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Refresh Action: Choose a player. Each hero that player controls that did not spend any resources this round gains 1 resource. Only 1 copy of Tighten Our Belts can be played by the players each round.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Silvan. Warrior.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Galadhon Archer enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy not engaged with you.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Weapon.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Attach to a Silvan character with the ranged keyword. Restricted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attached character gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if attacking an enemy not engaged with you.)

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dale. Scout.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Secrecy 2

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Celduin Traveler enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a location, you may discard it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to reduce your threat by X where X is the printed cost of the ally returned to your hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: You may give Mirkwood Pioneer doomed 1 when you play it from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Mirkwood Pioneer, choose a card in the staging area. Until the end of the round, the chosen card does not contribute its $.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Attach to a Ranger hero.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After attached hero commits to a quest, name enemy, location, or treachery. If a card of the named type is revealed during this quest phase, ready attached hero.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Attach to a non-objective unique ally in play.

property.name: Text
property.value:
The first player gains control of attached ally
Damage from undefended attacks against you may be assigned to attached ally.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: The first player takes control of Nalir. Set the Ancient Marsh-dweller aside, out of play. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Advance to a random stage 2A.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 1.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 2A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.
Player card effects cannot be used to gain resources or draw cards.
Forced: When the players defeat this stage, advance to a random stage 3A.

property.value: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 1.

property.value:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 2A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.
In order to commit characters to the quest, a player must first discard a card at random from his hand.
Forced: When the players defeat this stage, advance to a random stage 3A.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 1.

property.name: Text

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 2A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.
Each player cannot play more than 1 card each round.
Forced: When the players defeat this stage, advance to a random stage 3A.

property.name: Encounter Set

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 1. Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it.

property.value:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 3A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 3A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.
Each player cannot ready more than 5 characters during the refresh phase.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 1. Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it.

property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 3A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.
Each enemy in the staging area gets –20 engagement cost.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it. Then, Ancient Marsh-dweller makes an attack against each player in player order.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value:
Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, Ancient Marsh-dweller makes an attack against each player in order. Place 2 time counters on this stage.
When Ancient Marsh-dweller is defeated, the players win the game.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Keywords
property.value: The first player gains control of Nalir.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Forced: At the beginning of the refresh phase, raise your threat by 1 for each player in the game.
If Nalir leaves play, the players lose the game.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Cannot have attachments.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Ancient Marsh-dweller gets +1 $ and +1 Û for each resource token on it.
Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from the current quest, place a resource token here.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Cannot have attachments.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from the current quest, Giant Swamp Adder attacks the engaged player.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Traits
property.value: Creature. Insect.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from the current quest, the engaged player must deal 2 damage to an ally he controls.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: While Fen of Reeds is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After the players advance to a quest stage, each player must exhaust a character he controls.”

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each time counter on the quest.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Traits
property.value: River. Marsh.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Finger of Glanduin is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: At the end of each round, remove 1 progress from each location in play.”

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove all progress from the current quest.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value:
Response: After Hidden Eyot leaves play as an explored location, place 2 time counters on the current quest.
Travel: Each player must exhaust a character he controls to travel here.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: While Sinking Bog is in the staging area, each character gets –1 Ò, –1 Û, and –1 Ú for each Item attached to it. This ability does not stack with other copies of Sinking Bog.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Defending character gets –1 Ú for each attachment attached to it.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Nîn-in-Eilph

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Creature enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck. Cannot be canceled.
